SoniControl Block on each location Not available Empty detection cache Are you sure you want to delete the JSON-file? SoniControl Blocking ultrasonic communication SoniControl Detected ultrasonic signal SoniControl Paused SoniControl Scanning for ultrasonic sounds SoniControl Detected ultrasonic signal Pause Play Delete location entry Are you sure you want to delete the location entry? Not available You have not discovered any signals yet! The app requires at least the permission to access the microphone. Otherwise it cannot detect ultrasonic signals. Centering the map on your location requires "Location" permission. This permission is optional. No permission to access location. No permission to locally save map tiles. Technologies like Google Nearby and Silverpush build upon ultrasonic sounds to exchange data (data over audio). More and more of our devices communicate via this inaudible communication channel. Every device with a microphone and a speaker is able to send and receive ultrasonic information. Users are usually not aware of this inaudible and hidden data transfer. 

SoniControl is a novel technology for the recognition and masking of acoustic ultrasound communication. SoniControl detects ultrasonic communication, notifies the user and blocks the information on demand. Thereby, SoniControl helps end-users to protect their privacy from potential audio tracking. 

The project SoniControl has been financially supported by the funding program netidee (https://www.netidee.at) and has been developed in a research project at the Institute for Creative Media Technologies at the University of Applied Sciences Sankt PÃ¶lten (https://sonicontrol.fhstp.ac.at). The entire project is open source under GNU license. 

Privacy statement: SoniControl does not send any data from the users to other places and works even completely offline. All program data are stored locally on the phone. SoniControl requires microphone access to listen to the ultrasonic channel (all hearable information is filtered out). It further requires location information if the user wants the app to block ultrasonic communication permanently at a certain location (e.g. near to an audio beacon mounted next to some building). 

In case of questions, bugs, ideas, please contact us directly under https://sonicontrol.fhstp.ac.at/#contact or sonicontrol@fhstp.ac.at. Not able to access location Block always here Ignore this time Ignore always here Block this time Ultrasonic signal detected Play Detected signals Settings About us Credits 

 Audio by Superpowered (https://www.superpowered.com/)

Material Icons used, which are under the license of Apache License Version 2.0 (https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.txt ) Privacy policy About us Instructions Help Data collection and data processing:

 - We use the microphone to capture sound, but process only the ultrasonic part, we remove everything under 17kHz.

 - Sounds are analyzed in real time on the phone.

 - Detections are stored locally in a JSON file, including the time, the type of technology detected by our algorithm, the decision, whether the sound source shall be blocked in future or not and the location of the detection (if location access is permitted by the user). The user can delete this file at any time via the "settings" menu.

 - If allowed, we check the users' location regularly in order to start blocking when they enter an area covered by a firewall rule (e.g. where they previously detected ultrasonic communications and decided to block it in future).

 - The Internet permission is required to display the geographic map background and to share detections with the community. This permission is classified by Google/Android as uncritical (protection_normal). Therefore it is not shown in the permission overview of the app's detail information. No data is uploaded without the user opting in. Sharing is done on demand, when the user checks "Share detection", or automatically if an "always" firewall rule is met and the user opted in for sharing detections by default (from the "settings" menu). If the users share their detections, the time, technology detected, blocking decision, the location information (if allowed by the user) and a short audio sample of the detection (everything under 17kHz is removed), will be uploaded to the SoniControl server. No user ID is stored, and thus the data is anonymous. The uploaded audio samples are used to identify false detections of the firewall.

 - If allowed, the geolocation is used to center the map on your position.
Privacy policy https://sonicontrol.fhstp.ac.at Welcome to the SoniControl firewall.

SoniControl scans for ultrasonic messages coming from other phones or audio beacons in your environment and notifies you about such detections. On a detection you can choose to block the messages (also future messages at the same location) or to let it pass. 

SoniControl needs access to the microphone to work properly, and to your location (optional) to remember places where ultrasounds should be blocked. 

We do not transmit any data from your phone and do not store privacy-sensitive data.

Tap the play button to start scanning for ultrasonic signals. Instructions To save/see locations where ultrasonic communications were detected, you need to check the 'Save data in JSON file' setting No JSON file Cancel Save data in JSON file To save locations where ultrasonic communications were detected, you need to turn on location. 
You can turn on Location in 'Phone Settings' Location is off Phone Settings Not now Location is enabled Don't ask again Reset all settings to default Detected at: Location was not found and latest detection couldn't be saved Unknown address Microphone is already in use We could not start scanning, the microphone is already used by another app. Please activate location if you want to be able to save detections. Do you want to reset all settings? Reset settings Location radius (%s metres) Pulse duration (%s ms) Pause duration (%s ms) Bandwidth (%s Hz) Blocking duration (%s minute) Blocking duration (%s minutes) will be blocked will be ignored Advanced settings - Jammer Blocking Advanced - RESET Save detections in JSON file Clear detections of JSON file Don't ask for activating location Microphone for blocking Preventive blocking Network GPS Pulse duration (ms) Pause duration (ms) Bandwidth Blocking duration in minutes Location radius (metre) App status channel Signal detection channel Estimated type: You have not imported any signals yet! will ask again How to proceed? Wait for signal end Detections are shown in four tabs: "My Rules", "Imported Rules", "Detection History" and a map visualization. The first two act as firewall rules. Their color shows if the rule will be blocked (red), ignored (green) or ask you again on the next detection (orange). You can change the status by tapping on them several times. On tapping longer on them, you can delete each rule. The history tab shows all detections.
The map shows all firewall rules geographically. Share detections The color of the markers stands for the action of the firewall rule. 
- Red markers will be always blocked 
- Green markers will be always ignored 
- Orange markers will be asked again for a decision on the next detection of it. 

On tapping on the marker a circle will appear where its size represents the signal strength. The radius of the circle is NOT representing the distance of the signal source. Time to Pick date Location Range Please set your filters for importing detections! Import Time from Please enter an address! Please enter a range! Pick date My Rules Imported Rules History Rules on Map Set The server is not reachable. Your detection could not be shared. The detection was successfully uploaded. Last detection: Back to the map Open the Permission Menu The server is not reachable at the moment. Please try again later! Legend Share your detection Do you want to import the rules? The filter resulted in %s rules. previous Detections: Unknown Address Rules reset Importing Detections Settings "Extended diagnostics" - 
 
 "Block on each location" - Every detection will be blocked automatically and no alert will be shown.
 
 "Preventive blocking" - The time span between every detection and choice on the alert will be automatically blocked.
 
 "Share detections" - If checked, the user agrees with sending the anonymised detection to the server. This option can be also changed on every alert. If the alert is not shown e.g. if "Block on each location" is activated, this choice counts.
 
 "Save detections in JSON file" - If activated, every detection will be saved in a local JSON file to collect rules and show history entries.
 
 "Clear detections of JSON file" - This deletes the local JSON file and removes all rules and history entries.
